meanings.sent1: The old stone statue in the garden looked even mossier after the rainy season.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was getting mossier with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The abandoned house had a mysterious, mossier aura about it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like mossier vines, slowly creeping into every corner of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The damp, mossier smell of the cave lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Tending to become covered in moss.
meanings.sent1: The neglected fountain in the park was mossier than the rest.
meanings.sent2: The damp climate made the walls of the castle grow mossier over time.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat seemed to have a mossier approach to life than the energetic dog.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like mossier seeds, slowly taking root in the minds of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The mossier path led us deeper into the enchanted forest.

meanings.definition: Having the quality or characteristic of moss.
meanings.sent1: The plush carpet felt mossier under bare feet.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins had a mossier appearance as nature reclaimed them.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce had a mossier taste that intrigued the diners.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a mossier tone that calmed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The mossier texture of the fabric added a cozy feel to the room.
